['Conduct research and analysis to support portfolio level deliverables', 'Develop customer/competitor trends and analyses that present actionable intelligence that direct supports SAIC strategy development', 'Provide research, analysis and recommendations to support capture team decision making', 'Present analysis to capture and leadership teams and successfully back up analysis/answer questions', 'Provide constructive feedback to peer analysts in a group environment regarding CSI assumptions and analyses', 'Develop new tools and visualizations to support internal deliverables and BD community needs', 'Assist with process automation and improvement', 'Bachelor’s Degree', '9 + years experience in business development, market research & analysis, business strategy, competitive intelligence or related field with strategic/critical thinking', 'A background in data and business analysis to assist with developing a database or automating data aggregation process', 'Experience with FPDS, GovWin, FBO and other government database source', 'Ability to synthesize large amounts of data/research, analyze, identify trends and present logical conclusions and recommendations to leadership', 'Strength in data visualization – ability to clearly present findings', 'Fast learner with a positive attitude and time management skills', 'Excellent organization and attention to detail', 'Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical/strategic thinking capabilities', 'Preference will be given to candidates with experience in data management, data analysis and reporting, including dashboard development, data mining, modeling and/or data visualizations (i.e. Power BI)']

job_title: Middleware WebSphere System Administrator - US CITIZENS ONLY
job_text: ['Reporting to leadership on the Middleware team activities', 'Implementing complex changes to the infrastructure', 'Building and creating products and services', 'Supporting solutions that meet the requirements', 'Preparing documentation that explains the technical solution clearly', 'Maintaining or enhancing systems infrastructure components and services to ensure that infrastructure is in vendor supported and standards compliant state', 'Building technical expertise', 'Responding to incidents according to the government approved Incident Response Plan', 'Providing 24x7x365 integration support for all Middleware components (including networking) and OIT supported applications interfaces, including but not limited to MQ/Data Power support products (commercial-off-the-shelf and proprietary)', '3-10 years of experience and a B.S. degree. Bachelor of Science (BS) can be substituted with an additional 4 years of related experience.', '3 years’ experience in incident, problem and change management', '3 years’ experience working in a 2nd/3rd line IT support or project delivery environment', '2–3 years’ working in Redhat and AIX Linux platforms', '2-3 years’ experience within Middleware, JAVA or related technology', '3-5 years’ experience with Websphere Application Server 8 & higher, IBM HTTP 8.5 platform and/or WebSphere Portal Server 6.1 & higher', '3 years’ experience working on high visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program', '2-3 years’ scripting skills using wsadmin, Shell script, Python', '1 year experience using Change Management tools such as Remedy', '1 year experience working with Atlassian suite of products to manage projects', 'Experience with WebSphere Application Server & WebSphere Portal preferred, but can be substituted by training', 'Experience with Apache Tomcat preferred', 'Experience with Monitoring tools such as Tivoli Monitoring, OEM, AppD preferred', '401(k)', 'Dental Insurance', 'Health Insurance', 'Vision Insurance', 'Monday to Friday', 'IBM HTTP 8.5 or WebSphere Portal Server 6.1 or higher: 3 years (Required)', 'Incident, problem and change management: 3 years (Required)', 'Websphere Application Server 8 & higher: 3 years (Required)', 'Scripting with wsadmin or Shell script or Python: 1 year (Required)', '2nd/3rd line IT support: 3 years (Required)', 'Middleware, JAVA or related technology: 2 years (Required)', 'Redhat Linux and AIX platforms: 2 years (Required)', "Bachelor's (Preferred)", 'Springfield, VA 22153 (Required)', 'Willing to go through security clearance (Required)', 'Are you US Citizen (Required)', 'Can you work on W2 basis only (Required)', 'Able to work 3rd shift or Weekends or Holidays (Required)', 'No: Not providing sponsorship for this job', 'Waiting period may apply', 'Temporarily due to COVID-19']

['Investigating complaints and providing follow-up with appropriate personnel;', 'Performing regular building inspections to ensure safe conditions;', 'General building maintenance and repair work, including preventative maintenance;', 'Installing, inspecting, maintaining, and making general repairs to roofing, gutters, waterproofing, sealants, masonry, concrete, and other architectural building components;', 'Installing, inspecting, maintaining, and making general repairs to doors, frames and hardware; ceiling systems; flooring and floor finishes; windows; walls and wall finishes; building fixtures; millwork, casework and accessories;', 'Installing, inspecting, maintaining and making general repairs to plumbing fixtures and hardware;', 'May be responsible for installing, inspecting, maintaining and making general repairs to commercial low-voltage systems to include security and fire protection systems;', 'Maintaining records of work performed; and performing other related tasks.', 'Any combination of education and experience equivalent to high school diploma.', 'Three to five years of experience in two of the four major trades (carpentry, plumbing, mechanical and painting) with demonstrated ability to perform general building maintenance.', 'Preference for experience specifically in the areas of plumbing and/or door hardware (including electronic access systems) and/or commercial low voltage systems (specifically in security and fire alarm systems)', "Possession of a valid Virginia driver's license is required. (To view our driving eligibility requirements, go to the 'About City Jobs' section of our FAQs on the HR webpage or click here)", 'Satisfactory health condition in order to meet the physical requirements of the job.', 'Vacation: 3.09 hours accrued biweekly - 0 - <3 years 3.85 hours accrued biweekly - 3 - <5 years 4.62 hours accrued biweekly - 5 - <10 years 5.40 hours accrued biweekly - 10 - <15 years 6.16 hours accrued biweekly - 15 - <20 years 6.93 hours accrued biweekly - 20 - <25 years 7.70 hours accrued biweekly - 25+ years', 'Sick: 4.62 hours per biweekly pay period, approximately 120 hours a years, no limit on accumulation', 'Holidays: 12 paid holidays per calendar year (11 observed and 1 floating)', 'Aetna Medical – Choose from three options with different premiums and levels of coverage: HMO: $0 premium for employee only coverage POS 1: Employee-only premium of $36.29 per biweekly pay POS 2: Employee-only premium of $13.01 per biweekly pay Prescription Card ($10 generic, $30 lower cost name brand, $55 higher cost name brand) Mail Order Maintenance Prescription Drug Program ($20 generic, $60 lower cost name brand, $110 higher cost brand)', 'Dental (Delta Dental) Diagnosis and Preventive - 100% of allowable charge; Basic Dental Care - 80%; Major Dental Care - 50% Primary - $50 deductible, 80/20 Prosthetic & Complex Restorative - $50 deductible, 50/50 $1,500 maximum annual benefit $1,000 Orthodontic Benefit', 'MetLife Vision Plan: Optional Employee only coverage: $2.67 bi-weekly; Dependent coverage also available at differing rates. Eye health exam, dilatation, prescription and refraction of glasses covered after $10 co-pay; $130 allowance for frames, after co-pay, plus additional discounts where accepted.', 'Life: Two times annual salary (paid by the City) Optional supplemental life available for employee, spouse, dependents (paid by employee)', 'AFLAC: Optional Cancer/accident/short term disability/intensive care insurance (paid by employee)', 'Long Term Disability Protection from income loss due to long-term illness or injury (paid by the City)', "Pension: Choose from two options: A Defined Benefit Pension plan pays a monthly benefit in retirement using a defined formula based on the employee's earnings history, tenure of service, and age. Our plan has a 5 year vesting period and an employee contribution of 5% of salary. A Defined Contribution 401a plan in which fixed contributions are paid into an individual's account by the employer, the contributions are invested, returns (positive or negative) are credited to the account, and the account balance is used to provide retirement benefits. The vesting schedule for our 401a plan is 33% after one year of service, 67% after two years of service, and 100% after three years of service. There is no required contribution from salary. (Note that: the Defined Contribution retirement plan is the only plan available for Library employees)", 'Supplemental: Deferred Compensation (457) - employee contribution', 'Flexible Spending Accounts: Health Care Expenses Dependent Care Expenses Parking/Mass Transit Expenses Parking Subsidy of $50 per month', 'Wellness Programs: Monthly On-Site Nurse and Annual Flu Shots Health Screenings and Fairs, Education Sessions, & Weekly Fitness Classes Weight Watchers at Work', 'Bike Commuter Program: Reimbursement of up to $20 per month for reasonable bike commuting expenses', 'Employee Assistance Program: A variety of confidential, personal professional services for you and your family available 24 hours a day.', 'Tuition Reimbursement: Up to $1,200 for undergraduate OR Up to $2,000 for graduate level tuition per fiscal year per employee.']

['Develop and define manufacturing processes in support of formulation and product development.', 'Execute bench-top and pilot plant testing to develop prototypes and prove hypotheses.', 'Drive scale-up to Pilot Plant and Plant.', 'Review and analyze results of experiments and trials to provide recommendations. Prepare results for review and present findings.', 'Develop and maintain detailed documentation of ongoing and future projects and provide bi-weekly reviews on the status of projects and expenses.', 'Provide technical support in manufacturing facilities as required.', 'Monitor consumer trends and wants/needs within the food industry.', 'Assist in providing technical leadership on projects as required.', 'Develop/teach Operations associates', 'Excellent communication skills.', 'Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with individuals and groups at all levels of the organization.', 'Experience with process technology documentation, including Process Flow Sheets, Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams, Mass and Energy Balances, Process Control Strategies, and Process Specifications.', 'Experience with process technology including mixing and blending, flow control, heat exchangers, temperature regulation, homogenizers, Ammonia, Nitrogen/CO2 cooling/freezing methods and equipment, Sanitary/ Aseptic package Fillers, and CIP systems preferred.', 'Experience working with external work partners, vendors, and suppliers on sensitive/confidential matters.', 'BS Chemical, Food, or Biological Engineering preferred.', 'Recent graduate with 1-2 years related experience.', 'Experience working with external work partners, vendors, and suppliers on sensitive/confidential matters.', 'Exposure to process technologies including mixing, and blending, baking, temperature regulation, cooling/freezing methods, and other equipment.', 'Proficient in Microsoft office programs including Word, Excel, and Power Point.', 'Proficient in AutoCAD, and project management software.', 'Ability to work in a food-manufacturing/food distribution environment', 'While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.']

company: US Other Agencies and Independent Organizations
job_text: ['Job family (Series)0501 Financial Administration And Program', 'RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentThis is a Drug Testing position.U.S. Citizenship RequiredYou must meet the qualifications for this position by no later than 30 calendar days after the closing date of this announcement and before placement in the position.QualificationsIn order to qualify for this position, you must have at least one year of specialized experience at the next lower grade level (GG-13) level in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Experience in planning, coordinating, and providing financial and data analysis and oversight of programs. Experience includes budgeting experience; including but not limited to planning, formulation and execution of sound fiscal budgets within an assigned organization(s). Experience supporting information technology/information management (IT/IM) budget resources is preferred. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:Thorough knowledge of the principles, practices, and requirements governing Federal budget process (formulation and execution), financial management, performance management, Information Technology (IT) acquisition, Financial Systems, Acquisition Management Systems, IT portfolio structure, Data Visualization in terms of gathering, analyzing, and displaying financial management data and information in reports, using graphical charts, and figures.Demonstrated skill in planning, program analysis and problem-solving to analyze budgetary, financial, administrative and policy issues underlying major office programs and their effect on the delivery of management support services, and to develop recommendations for their resolution.Demonstrated skill in effectively presenting information, ideas and advice in a clear, concise, and logical manner.Demonstrated ability to work efficiently in handling multiple with competing priories, often under considerable pressure to meet deadlines. Assignments are related to budget formulation and budget execution.You may also provide additional information related to your qualifications in the vacancy questions provided for supplemental responses. Describe specific experiences, education and training which demonstrates your knowledge, skills, and abilities. Feel free to provide examples of your and describe your role.EducationNo education required.Additional informationMore than one position may be filled. As additional vacancies are identified, additional selections can be made. Vacancies may be filled under the Budget Formulation Team and Budget Execution Team (BET) within FMB.This position is subject to Financial Disclosure reporting requirements.The NRC provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Individuals with disabilities may contact the Selective Placement Coordinator for assistance with the application or hiring process via Disability.Resource@nrc.gov. job_title: Director, Engineering - Billing Event Processing Platform
job_text: ['You have a track record of leading distributed systems engineering and operations teams in software companies. Experience with distributed systems in large install environments.', 'You have extensive technical expertise in high fidelity data pipelines and data processing systems', 'You are highly data driven in decision making and understand what makes good input and output metrics and the mechanisms to support them.', 'Experience building engineering teams from scratch. Strong focus on org structure and shape hygiene.', 'You are passionate about engineering hygiene and operational excellence. You have the know-how to build an engineering organization that delivers it. You focus on quality through metrics-based defect tracking and pride in delivery.', 'You have expertise with agile methodologies, continuous integration, and test automation.', "You are a strategic thinker as it relates to scale and removing humans from the loop. You thrive when operating in broad scope, from conception through continuous operation of 24x7 services to defined SLA's.", 'You distill complex and ambiguous situations into aligned priorities with actionable plans for your team. Focus on the customer and business outcomes.', 'Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to be personable yet persistent. You are able to articulate the "why" for a team\'s priorities and the customer impact.', 'Proven track record of meeting business targets.', 'EMPOWER OTHERS: Curate, lead and grow a team of passionate engineers. Provide support and guidance that enables the team to self-organize and to achieve sustained high velocity and predictability.', 'DRAW THE OWL: Deliver engineering plans and architecture for a micro-transactional billing processing system that is able to support the real-time requirements of pay-as-you-go and a credits system as well as invoiced customers.', "EMPOWER OTHERS: Help employees grow through career development, coaching, and mentoring while guiding senior contributors to maximize their potential. You'll provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans, defining goals, perform evaluations, and collaborate with employees on their objectives. Most of all, ensure employees are having fun with their work.", "BE AN OWNER: Own, operate, and maintain your team's services. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers. Enhance and maintain a rotating on-call incident escalation and response process.", "BE BOLD: Be a leader of a critical part of Twilio's senior engineering team and contribute to Twilio's overall billing and pricing platform strategy", "DON'T SETTLE: Collaborate on roadmaps with Product Managers, Architects, and Tech Leads to ensure the organization has clear direction and priorities related to performance metrics that track business performance.", 'BE INCLUSIVE: Act as an ambassador for Twilio, recruiting and motivating top talent']

job_title: Automotive Technicians / Mechanics - Your 4-Day Work Week is Here!
job_text: ['Performing work as outlined on repair orders with efficiency, accuracy, and in accordance with dealership and factory standards', 'Experienced technicians will diagnose the cause of any malfunction and perform appropriate repairs', 'Maintaining related records and documentation, including all preformed and recommended work on the repair order', 'Operating all tools and equipment in a safe manner', 'Road testing vehicles as needed', 'Performing other duties as assigned', 'Injects grease into units, such as springs, universal joints, and steering knuckles, using hand or compressed-air powered grease gun', 'Inspects fluid levels of steering gear, power steering reservoir, transmission, differential, rear axle housings and shackles', 'Checks air pressure of tires', 'Lubricates moving parts with specific lubricants', 'Drains oil from crankcase and refills with required amount of oil', 'Spray leaf springs with lubricant, using spray gun', 'Replace oil and air filters', 'Inspects all vehicles for additional repairs needed', '401(k)', '401(k) Matching', 'Dental Insurance', 'Disability Insurance', 'Employee Assistance Program', 'Employee Discount', 'Flexible Schedule', 'Flexible Spending Account', 'Health Insurance', 'Life Insurance', 'Paid Time Off', 'Professional Development Assistance', 'Referral Program', 'Vision Insurance', 'Monday to Friday', 'Automotive Technician: 3 years (Preferred)', "Driver's License with 2 or fewer moving violations (Required)", 'Bonuses', 'Store Discounts', 'One location', 'Bi weekly or Twice monthly', 'Cars and light trucks', 'Dealership', 'www.mileonejobs.com']

job_title: Cost Engineer / Financial Analyst - Project Controls
job_text: ['Monitor project budgets for the multi-billion dollar Capital Improvement Programs at Los Angeles World Airports and Gas and Electric Utilities around Southern California', 'Review and analyze sub-contractor invoices. Prepares job costing reports to allocate these expenditures against the appropriate WBS numbers. Ensure that both commitments and expenditures follow the same allocation methodology.', 'Perform cost-to-complete analysis for all cost elements within a project taking into consideration staffing plans, contract commitments, and expenditures to date, change orders and trends.', 'Attend project meetings to provide Project Management with current financial information and trend log regarding potential impacts to project budget or forecast.', 'Provide progress reporting documents and briefing materials as required. Develop creative reporting tools to communicate complex project sequencing and/or progress assessments.', 'Review task orders for contractors and sub-consultants to ensure necessary budget and/or contract capacity exists.', 'Analyze bid award values against current budget and prepare reconciliations to include in the current forecast at completion.', 'Analyze change order values against current budget and prepare reconciliations to include in the current forecast at completion.', 'Prepare data to support documentation required journal vouchers for budget transfers', 'Thorough familiarity with MS office suite software - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, (highly proficient in Excel..advanced functions such as VLOOKUP’s, pivot tables, filtering/sorting, charts and graphing).', 'Experience in SAS or SAS VA (Visual Analytics).', 'Experience performing SQL queries.', 'Experience programming with Visual Basic is a plus.', 'Other software that may be beneficial; Business Objects, Crystal Reports, JIRA, NetSuite, Power BI, PowerPoint, Python/Orange, R Studio, Report Builder, Enterprise/VA, SharePoint, SSRS, Tableau, Visio', 'Familiarity with Primavera, (P6), familiarity', '5- to 10-years cost engineering experience with 3- to 5-years in direct support of an active construction projects.', 'Demonstrated experience managing and reporting the cost components of large-scale, complex projects; including developing and managing a progress reporting methodology for a complicated design effort.', 'Experience with Design-Build and Construction Management at Risk delivery methods is desirable.', 'Demonstrated ability to understand technical and complicated construction program and the ability to communicate progress to both technical- and management-level personnel.', 'Ability to work with others, a self-starter with results-driven focus.', 'Flexible to a potentially varying shift time or overtime schedule.', 'Please provide relevant project history.', 'construction cost engineering: 5 years (Required)', 'United States (Required)', 'Are you located in Southern California?']
